help.descr:
This function returns a structure with default option settings for solvers used in MPT.
Used by mptopt class by first time initialization of MPT. Later these settings are changed via mptopt class.

field.name: clp
field.descr: settings for CLP solver

field.name: solver
field.descr: Which method to choose for solving LP/QP.

field.name: maxnumiterations
field.descr: Maximum number of iterations allowed

field.name: maxnumseconds
field.descr: Maximum time allowed for computation in seconds

field.name: primaltolerance
field.descr: Tolerance on the primal solution.

field.name: dualtolerance
field.descr: Tolerance on the dual solution.

field.name: primalpivot
field.descr: Which pivot method to choose for primal solution.

field.name: dualpivot
field.descr: Which pivot method to choose for dual solution.

field.name: verbose
field.descr: Verbosity level.

field.name: cplexint
field.descr: Settings for CPLEX solver interfaced by Automatic Control Laboratory (cplexint).

field.name: verbose
field.descr: Verbosity level.

field.name: logfile
field.descr: Redirect output to a file.

field.name: lic_rel
field.descr: After how many runs to release the license.

field.name: cplex
field.descr: Settings for CPLEX solver interfaced by IBM.

field.name: lpmethod
field.descr: Which method to use for solving LP.

field.name: qpmethod
field.descr: Which method to use for solving QP.

field.name: plcp
field.descr: settings for PLCP solver

field.name: bfs
field.descr: Perform breadth first search when explorting the parameter space.

field.name: dfs
field.descr: Perform breadth first search when explorting the parameter space.

field.name: debug
field.descr: Debugging level

field.name: fixedstep
field.descr: Always perform a step over the facet with a fixed step size given as region_tol. An alternative way to detect regions while exploring the parameter space. The approach is useful when numerical problems occurs with the standard method where the step size is computed automatically.

field.name: QRfactor
field.descr: Inside the main pivoting funtion use recursive QR factorization instead of direct LU factorization. It will speed up the computation time but will suffer from numerical problems for large LCP problems.

field.name: checkoverlaps
field.descr: Check for overlaps while exploring the parameter space. This option enforces to search through all discovered regions at each step for overlaps. If the overlap is detected, the overlapping part is discarted via set-difference operation. Since this requires solving an LP for each region, this option reduces the computational time significantly.

field.name: rescue
field.descr: If the variable step approach fails to find adjacent region, retry with the fixed step. The step size is given as the Chebyshev radius of the smallest allowable region, i.e. half of the region_tol.

field.name: maxsteps
field.descr: Maximum number of steps to perform with the fixed step approach in case no new regions have been found. Minimum 2-steps must be provided.

field.name: maxlayers
field.descr: Maximum value of layers to be explored for breadth first search (BFS). This option is valid only with BFS option. Useful only if there are too many regions far from the initial region that can be discarded from optimal solution. The layered list of regions is returned in the field layer_list.

field.name: maxregions
field.descr: Maximum number of regions to be generated.

field.name: maxpivots
field.descr: The maximum number of pivots to be performed to find a neighboring region. Typically, the are 1, 2 pivots to be performed to find a neighboring regions. For a degenerate case, more pivots are needed. The maximum value of the pivots is given by the RecursionLimit of MATLAB which 500 by default. If the value of maxpivots is greater than RecursionLimit, change also this value by set(0,'RecursionLimit',N).

field.name: lcp
field.descr: settings for LCP solver

field.name: zerotol
field.descr: Less than this treshold the value is considered as zero.

field.name: lextol
field.descr: Lexicographic tolerance - a small treshold from which values are considered as equal.

field.name: nstepf
field.descr: If options.routine is 0, then every nstepf pivot steps the basis is refactorized to avoid numerical problems for LUMOD. For other routines the factorization is performed at each step.

field.name: maxpiv
field.descr: Maximum number of pivots to be performed.

field.name: clock
field.descr: Show the information about the computational time.

field.name: verbose
field.descr: Verbose output.

field.name: routine
field.descr: Routine which should be used to obtain a basis solution.

class.name: double
class.descr: Corresponds to LUmod package that performs factorization in the form LA = U. Depending on the change in A factors L, U are updated. This is the fastest method.

Corresponds to DGESV simple driver from LAPACK package which solves the system AX = B by factorizing A and overwriting B with the solution X. Since the factorization is performed at each pivot step, this method tends to be much slower than method 0.

Corresponds to DGELS simple driver which solves overdetermined or underdetermined real linear systems \text{min}~~ \|b - Ax\|_2 involving an M-by-N matrix A, or its transpose, using a QR or LQ factorization of A. Since the factorization is performed at each pivot step, this method tends to be much slower than method 0.

field.name: timelimit
field.descr: Time limit in seconds. If this limit is exceeded, the pivoting algorithm is terminated and current basis is returned.

field.name: normalize
field.descr: Input matrices M, q get scaled by D_1 and D_2 when invoking this option: M_n = D_{1}MD_{2}, q_n = D_{1}q, and solution is recovered as z = D_{2}z_{n}, w = Mz+q.

field.name: normalizethres
field.descr: If the normalize option is on, then the matrix scaling is performed only if 1 norm of matrix M (maximum absolute column sum) is above this threshold.

field.name: glpk
field.descr: settings for GLPK solver

field.name: msglev
field.descr: Level of messages output by solver routines.

field.name: lpsolver
field.descr: Which method to choose for solving primal LP.

field.name: scale
field.descr: Which method of scaling to use.

class.name: double
class.descr: Geometric mean scaling, then equilibration scaling.
Round to nearest power of 2 scaling.

field.name: dual
field.descr: Which method to choose for solving dual LP.

class.name: double
class.descr: Do not use the dual simplex.
If initial basic solution is dual feasible, use the dual simplex.
Use two phase dual simplex, or if primal simplex if dual fails.

field.name: price
field.descr: Pricing option (for both primal and dual simplex).

field.name: r_test
field.descr: Ratio test technique.

field.name: relax
field.descr: Relaxation parameter used in the ratio test. If it is zero, the textbook ratio test is used. If it is non-zero (should be positive), Harris two-pass ratio test is used. In the latter case on the first pass of the ratio test basic variables (in the case of primal simplex) or reduced costs of non-basic variables (in the case of dual simplex) are allowed to slightly violate their bounds, but not more than relax*tolbnd or relax*toldj (thus, relax is a percentage of tolbnd or toldj).

field.name: tolbnd
field.descr: Relative tolerance used to check ifthe current basic solution is primal feasible. It is not recommended that you change this parameter unless you have a detailed understanding of its purpose.

field.name: toldj
field.descr: Absolute tolerance used to check if the current basic solution is dual feasible. It is not recommended that you change this parameter unless you have a detailed understanding of its purpose.

field.name: tolpiv
field.descr: Relative tolerance used to choose eligible pivotal elements of the simplex table. It is not recommended that you change this parameter unless you have a detailed understanding of its purpose.

field.name: round
field.descr: Solution rounding option.

class.name: logical
class.descr: Report all primal and dual values "as is" (default).
Replace tiny primal and dual values by exact zero.

field.name: objll
field.descr: Lower limit of the objective function. If on the phase II the objective function reaches this limit and continues decreasing, the solver stops the search. This parameter is used in the dual simplex method only.

field.name: objul
field.descr: Upper limit of the objective function. If on the phase II the objective function reaches this limit and continues increasing, the solver stops the search. This parameter is used in the dual simplex only.

field.name: itlim
field.descr: Simplex iterations limit. If this value is positive, it is decreased by one each time when one simplex iteration has been performed, and reaching zero value signals the solver to stop the search. Negative value means no iterations limit.

field.name: itcnt
field.descr: Output frequency, in iterations. This parameter specifies how frequently the solver sends information about the solution to the standard output.

field.name: usecuts
field.descr: glp_intopt generates and adds cutting planes to the MIP problem in order to improve its LP relaxation before applying the branch-and-bound method.

field.name: pprocess
field.descr: Pre-processing technique option (for MIP only).

field.name: binarize
field.descr: Binarizeation option (for MIP), used only if presolver is enabled.

class.name: logical
class.descr: Replace general integer variables by binary ones.

field.name: tmlim
field.descr: Searching time limit, in seconds. If this value is positive, it is decreased each time when one simplex iteration has been performed by the amount of time spent for the iteration, and reaching zero value signals the solver to stop the search. Negative value means no time limit

field.name: branch
field.descr: Branching heuristic option (for MIP only).

class.name: double
class.descr: Branch on the most fractional variable.
Branch using a heuristic by Driebeck and Tomlin.

field.name: btrack
field.descr: Backtracking heuristic option (for MIP only).

class.name: double
class.descr: Backtrack using the best projection heuristic.

field.name: tolint
field.descr: Relative tolerance used to check if the current basic solution is integer feasible. It is not recommended that you change this parameter unless you have a detailed understanding of its purpose.

field.name: outdly
field.descr: Output delay, in seconds. This parameter specifies how long the solver should delay sending information about the solution to the standard output. Non-positive value means no delay.

field.name: tolobj
field.descr: Relative tolerance used to check if the value of the objective function is not better than in the best known integer feasible solution. It is not recommended that you change this parameter unless you have a detailed understanding of its purpose.

field.name: presol
field.descr: If this flag is set, the routine lpx_simplex solves the problem using the built-in LP presolver. Otherwise the LP presolver is not used.

field.name: save
field.descr: If this parameter is nonzero save a copy of the original problem to file.

field.name: mipgap
field.descr: The relative mip gap tolerance. If the relative mip gap for currently known best integer feasible solution falls below this tolerance, the solver terminates the search. This allows obtaining suboptimal interger feasible solutions if solving the problem to optimality takes too long.

field.name: gurobi
field.descr: settings for GUROBI solver

field.name: BarIterLimit
field.descr: Limits the number of barrier iterations performed (barrier only).

field.name: CutOff
field.descr: If the objective value for the optimal solution is better than the specified cutoff, the solver will return the optimal solution. Otherwise, it will terminate with a CUTOFF status.

field.name: IterationLimit
field.descr: Limits the number of simplex iterations performed.

field.name: NodeLimit
field.descr: Limits the number of MIP nodes explored (MIP only).

field.name: SolutionLimit
field.descr: Limits the number of feasible solutions found (MIP only).

field.name: TimeLimit
field.descr: Limits the total time expended (in seconds).

field.name: BarConvTol
field.descr: Barrier convergence tolerance (barrier only). The barrier solver terminates when the relative difference between the primal and dual objective values is less than the specified tolerance. Value must be in range [1e-10, 1].

field.name: BarConvTol
field.descr: Barrier convergence tolerance (barrier only). The barrier solver terminates when the relative difference between the primal and dual objective values is less than the specified tolerance. Value must be in range [1e-10, 1].

field.name: BarQCPConvTol
field.descr: The barrier solver terminates when the relative difference between the primal and dual objective values is less than the specified tolerance. ightening this tolerance may lead to a more accurate solution, but it may also lead to a failure to converge. Values must be in range [0, 1];

field.name: FeasibilityTol
field.descr: All constraints must be satisfied to a tolerance of FeasibilityTol. Tightening this tolerance can produce smaller constraint violations, but for numerically challenging models it can sometimes lead to much larger iteration counts. Value must be in range [1e-9, 1e-2].

field.name: IntFeasTol
field.descr: Integer feasibility tolerance (MIP only). An integrality restriction on a variable is considered satisfied when the variable's value is less than INTFEASTOL from the nearest integer value. Value must be in range [1e-9, 1e-1].

field.name: OptimalityTol
field.descr: Dual feasibility tolerance. Reduced costs must all be smaller than OptimalityTol in the improving direction in order for a model to be declared optimal. Value must be in range [1e-9, 1e-2].

field.name: MIPGap
field.descr: Relative MIP optimality gap (MIP only). The MIP engine will terminate (with an optimal result) when the gap between the lower and upper objective bound is less than MIPGap times the upper bound.

field.name: PSDTol
field.descr: Positive semi-definite tolerance (QP/MIQP only). Sets a limit on the amount of diagonal perturbation that the optimizer is allowed to perform on the Q matrix in order to correct minor PSD violations. If a larger perturbation is required, the optimizer will terminate with an GRB_ERROR_Q_NOT_PSD error.

field.name: InfUnbdInfo
field.descr: Determines whether simplex (and crossover) will compute additional information when a model is determined to be infeasible or unbounded. Set this parameter if you want to query the unbounded ray for unbounded models (through the UnbdRay attribute), or the infeasibility proof for infeasible models (through the FarkasDual and FarkasProof attributes).

field.name: NormAdjust
field.descr: Chooses from among multiple pricing norm variants. The details of how this parameter affects the simplex pricing algorithm are subtle and difficult to describe, so we've simply labeled the options 0 through 3. The default value of -1 chooses automatically. Changing the value of this parameter rarely produces a significant benefit.

field.name: PerturbValue
field.descr: Magnitude of the simplex perturbation. Note that perturbation is only applied when progress has stalled, so the parameter will often have no effect. Values must be in range [0, 0.01].

field.name: ScaleFlag
field.descr: Enables or disables model scaling. Scaling usually improves the numerical properties of the model, which typically leads to reduced solution times, but it may sometimes lead to larger constraint violations in the original, unscaled model.

field.name: ObjScale
field.descr: Divides the model objective by the specified value to avoid numerical errors that may result from very large objective coefficients. The default value of 0 decides on the scaling automatically. A value less than zero uses the maximum coefficient to the specified power as the scaling (so ObjScale=-0.5 would scale by the square root of the largest objective coefficient).

field.name: BarCorrectors
field.descr: Limits the number of central corrections performed in each barrier iteration. The default value chooses automatically, depending on problem characteristics. The automatic strategy generally works well, although it is often possible to obtain higher performance on a specific model by selecting a value manually. The values must be in range [-1, Inf)

field.name: Method
field.descr:
Algorithm used to solve continuous models or the root node of a MIP model. Concurrent optimizers run multiple solvers on multiple threads simultaneously, and choose the one that finishes first. Deterministic concurrent (Method=4) gives the exact same result each time, while Method=3 is often faster but can produce different optimal bases when run multiple times. In the current release, the default Automatic (Method=-1) will typically choose non-deterministic concurrent (Method=3) for an LP, barrier (Method=2) for a QP or QCP, and dual (Method=1) for the MIP root node. Only simplex and barrier algorithms are available for continuous QP models. Only primal and dual simplex are available for solving the root of an MIQP model. Only barrier is available for continuous QCP models.
The default setting is rarely significantly slower than the best possible setting, so you generally won't see a big gain from changing this parameter. There are classes of models where one particular algorithm is consistently fastest, though, so you may want to experiment with different options when confronted with a particularly difficult model.
Note that if memory is tight on an LP model, you should consider choosing the dual simplex method (Method=1). The default will invoke the concurrent optimizer, which typically consumes a lot more memory than dual simplex alone.

field.name: Presolve
field.descr: Controls the presolve level. A value of -1 corresponds to an automatic setting.

field.name: TimeLimit
field.descr: Limits the total time expended (in seconds).

field.name: Threads
field.descr: Controls the number of threads to apply to parallel MIP. The default value of 0 sets the thread count equal to the maximum value, which is the number of processors in the machine. Value should range from 0 to maximum number of processors.

field.name: OutputFlag
field.descr: Verbosity level.

field.name: DisplayInterval
field.descr: Controls the frequency at which log lines are printed (in seconds).

field.name: nag
field.descr: settings for NAG solver

field.name: qp
field.descr: settings for QP solver

field.name: ftol
field.descr: The maximum acceptable violation in each constraint at a "feasible" point.

field.name: rank_tol
field.descr: Enables the user to control the condition number of the triangular factor R.

field.name: crash_tol
field.descr: A constraint of the form a^{T}x \ge l will be included in the initial working set if |a^{T}x-l| \le \text{crash\_tol} \times (1+|l|) 0.0 < \text{options.crash\_tol} \le 1.0.

field.name: reset_ftol
field.descr: This option is part of an anti-cycling procedure designed to guarantee progress even on highly degenerate problems.

field.name: max_iter
field.descr: maximum number of iterations to be performed

field.name: fcheck
field.descr: every fcheck iterations, a numerical test is made to see if the current solution satisfies the constraints in the working set

field.name: inf_bound
field.descr: defines the "infinite" bound in the definition of the problem constraints

field.name: lp
field.descr: settings for LP solver

field.name: ftol
field.descr: The maximum acceptable violation in each constraint at a "feasible" point.

field.name: optim_tol
field.descr: Enables the user to control the condition number of the triangular factor R.

field.name: crash_tol
field.descr: A constraint of the form a^{T}x \ge l will be included in the initial working set if |a^{T}x-l| \le \text{crash\_tol} \times (1+|l|) 0.0 < \text{options.crash\_tol} \le 1.0.

field.name: reset_ftol
field.descr: This option is part of an anti-cycling procedure designed to guarantee progress even on highly degenerate problems.

field.name: max_iter
field.descr: maximum number of iterations to be performed

field.name: fcheck
field.descr: every fcheck iterations, a numerical test is made to see if the current solution satisfies the constraints in the working set

field.name: inf_bound
field.descr: defines the "infinite" bound in the definition of the problem constraints

field.name: qpip
field.descr: settings for QPC interior point solver "qpip"

field.name: mu
field.descr: Desired complementarity gap target (point on central-path).

field.name: method
field.descr: If method=1, then a faster but less accurate linear solve step is used. Conversely, if method=0 then a slower but more accurate linear solve step is used.

field.name: qpspline
field.descr: settings for QPspline solver

field.name: maxiter
field.descr: The maximum number of iterations.

field.name: abs_tol
field.descr: Absolute tolerance.

field.name: nstepf
field.descr: After these nstepf steps the basis will be refactored with new Q, R, factors.

field.name: nqrelems
field.descr: Do recursive QR factorization if the number of changed elements (rows/cols) is less than this treshold. If the treshold is large, the recursive factorization may actually consume more time than direct factorization. Large treshold causes also accumulation of numerical errors.

field.name: timelimit
field.descr: Time limit on the computations in seconds.

field.name: verbose
field.descr: Show the iteration progress.

field.name: quadprog
field.descr: settings for QUADPROG solver

field.name: MaxIter
field.descr: Maximum number of iterations allowed.

field.name: TolFun
field.descr: Termination tolerance on the function value.

field.name: TolX
field.descr: Termination tolerance on the solution.

field.name: Display
field.descr: Display progress of optimization.

field.name: Algorithm
field.descr: Algorithm for solving the QP

field.name: LargeScale
field.descr: Use large-scale or medium-scale algorithms.

field.name: linprog
field.descr: settings for LINPROG solver

field.name: MaxIter
field.descr: Maximum number of iterations allowed.

field.name: TolFun
field.descr: Termination tolerance on the function value.

field.name: TolX
field.descr: Termination tolerance on the solution.

field.name: Display
field.descr: Display progress of optimization.

field.name: sedumi
field.descr: settings for SEDUMI solver

field.name: fid
field.descr: Verbosity level

field.name: alg
field.descr: Type of algorithm that solves the problem.

class.name: double
class.descr: The first-order wide region algorithm is used, not recommended.
The centering-predictor-corrector algorithm is used with v-linearization.
The xz-linearization is used in the corrector, similar to Mehrotra's algorithm.

field.name: theta
field.descr: The wide region parameter which varies 0 < \texttt{theta} \le 1.

field.name: beta
field.descr: The neighborhood region parameter which varies 0 < \texttt{beta} \le 1.

field.name: stepdif
field.descr: Set primal/dual differentiation step length.

field.name: w
field.descr: The weights for the relative primal, dual and gap residuals as w(1):w(2):1 in order to find the optimal step differentiation.

field.name: eps
field.descr: The desired accuracy.

field.name: bigeps
field.descr: In case the desired accuracy cannot be achieved, SEDUMI tries to satisfy this accuracy.

field.name: maxiter
field.descr: Maximum iterations allowed.

field.name: cg
field.descr: Settings for preconditioned conjugate gradient method (CG), which is only used if results from Cholesky are inaccurate.

field.name: maxiter
field.descr: Maximum number of CG-iterates (per solve). Theoretically needed is |add|+2*|skip|, the number of added and skipped pivots in Cholesky.

field.name: restol
field.descr: Terminates if residual is a restol fraction of duality gap. Should be smaller than 1 in order to make progress.

field.name: refine
field.descr: Number of refinement loops that are allowed. The maximum number of actual CG-steps will thus be 1+(1+refine)*maxiter.

field.name: stagtol
field.descr: Terminates if relative function progress less than stagtol.

field.name: qprec
field.descr: Stores cg-iterates in quadruple precision if true.

field.name: chol
field.descr: Parameters for controling the Cholesky solve.

field.name: canceltol
field.descr: Relative tolerance for detecting cancelation during Cholesky.

field.name: maxu
field.descr: Adds to diagonal if max(abs(L(:,j))) > maxu otherwise.

field.name: abstol
field.descr: Skips pivots falling below abstol.

field.name: maxuden
field.descr: Pivots in dense-column factorization so that these factors satisfy max(abs(Lk)) <= maxuden.

field.name: errors
field.descr: If this field is true then SEDUMI outputs some error measures as defined in the Seventh DIMACS Challenge.
